#summary How to get PsyMP3 to (hopefully) run on FreeBSD
#labels Phase-Deploy,Featured

= Introduction =

For the most part, PsyMP3 is a Wine-friendly application. However, on occasion, there are some issues with it. Here's some quick tips to get it working

= Tips =

First, start Winecfg.

http://img707.imageshack.us/img707/2858/winecfgstart.png

Secondly, add an override for PsyMP3. Click "Add Application..." and select the PsyMP3 executable like so:

http://img717.imageshack.us/img717/5998/winecfgchoosefile.png

Select the psymp3.exe override. Set the Windows version to Windows XP.

http://img193.imageshack.us/img193/6739/winecfgwinver.png

Go to the Audio tab. Make sure that the psymp3.exe title still appears in the titlebar. Set the DirectSound Hardware Acceleration to "Emulation". 

http://img191.imageshack.us/img191/2450/winecfgaudio.png

And there you have it! PsyMP3 should now work under FreeBSD.
